terms.title: Machine learning
terms.tooltip: Machine learning is a field of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and improve from experience ...
terms.content: There are two distinct node type, storage nodes and bandwidth nodes, each being a network peer that the corresponding provider type operates in order to provision their service to the network. There is a reference software implementation of each node, called Colossus and Argus, respectively, but in principle there could be alternative node implementations for the same underlying protocol described in document.

nodes.title: Storage nodes are primarily involved in
content: downloading data to be stored from other storage nodes,
uploading data to other storage nodes and bandwidth nodes that may require it,
dropping data which is deleted from the network,

nodes.title: and bandwidth nodes are primarily involved in
content: uploading data to users upon request,
downloading data from storage providers in accordance with local caching policy,

others.title: Service-level agreement
others.subtitle: There is no direct protocol level enforcement of what service-level agreement each node should conform to, for example in terms of:

others.title: Want to learn more?
others.subtitle: For a detailed overview of how each node works, please review the: Nodes overview
